intro: Pavetta corynostylis, commonly known as the narrow-styled pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a typical feature of the Rubiaceae family. Pavetta corynostylis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
